CRLCS05036-d-09-11-05-CRL.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
CRLCS05036-d-09-11-05-CRL.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
CRLCS05036-d-09-11-05-CRL.Narrative:
THE 1400 BEDFORD PARK CREW DERAILED TWO CARS OF A THREE PACK DTTX 27659 ON CSX TRAIN Q159. THE CREWWAS FOLLOWING CSX TRAIN Q129 AT THE DIRECTION OF THE CSXI YARDMASTER . WHEN THE TRAIN BEGAN TO SLOW,CRL ENGINEER ATTEMPTED TO MAKE A REDUCTION WITH THE AUTOMATIC BRAKE VALVE BUT RECEIVED NO RESPONSE.HE THEN NOTED THAT HE HAD ONLT 58 LBS OF AIR ON THE END OF THE TRAIN DEVICE. HE PLACED THE TRAIN INEMERGENCY WHICH PRECIPITATED A VIOLENT RUN-IN DERAILING ONE TRUCK EACH ON THE 2ND AND 3RD CARS ON THE THREE PACK. THE TUBS WERE CONNECTED WITH  A SOLID DRAWBAR.  A SEVERE LEAK WAS FOUND ON FEC 71867LOCATED 1700 FEET FROM THE END OF THE TRAIN.THE CRL CREW SET REAR END OVER FOLL0WING THE DERAILMENT.THEY REPORTED A READING IN EXCESS OF 100 LBS ON THE AIR FLOW METER WITH THE BRAKES RELEASED. THEY CONTROLLED THE TRAIN USING THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE. CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE TRAIN HANDLING BY ENGINEER.
AFTER FURTHER INVESTIGATION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE LOCOMOTIVE ENGINEER DID NOT TAKE THE APPROPRIATE ACTIONS FOR THE PROPER HANDLING OF THIS TRAIN.

ALL THREE PIECES OF EQUIPMENT WENT DOWN THEIR HILL, OVER A DERAIL AND THRU THE SWITCH TO OUR YARD TRACK, CRASHING INTO PILE AT THE END OF OURYARD TRACK.  TRACKMOBILE AND LOADED RAILCAR DERAILED.  EMPLOYEE JUMPED OFF TRACKMOBILE.  NO INJURIES, NO FATALITIES.

IMR4005DR-d-09-11-05-IMRR.Narrative: UNITS CLIMBED POINT OF SWITCH AT CROSS-OVER.   SWITCHES WERE LINED AND LOCKED FOR CROSS-OVER MOVEMENT.  UNITS WERE LITE.

2005288-d-09-24-05-ICE.Narrative: MMCDQ24 WAS SETTING OUT 25 CARS OF CORN TO #2 TRACK.  ENGINEER REPORTED THAT HE WAS HAVING A HARD TIME SHOVING CARS, SO MOVEMENT WAS STOPPED.  UPON INVESTIGATION DISCOVERED 25TH THROUGH 28TH CARS DERAILED.  CAR 25 - DME 482058 HAD ALL WHEELS DERAILED AND WAS LEANING AGAINST CPLX 382241, A LOAD OF POTASSIUM CHLORIDE ON #3 TRACK.  CAR 26 - DME 6025 HAD ALL WHEELS DERAILED AND LEANING AGAINST GATX 58644, A LOAD OF ANHYDROUS.  CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

2005292-d-09-29-05-ICE.Narrative: SPKC27 INBOUND CREW WAS DOUBLING THE HEAD END OF THEIR TRAIN FROM THE INDUSTRY TRACK TO #2 TRACK ATW. DAVENPORT VIA THE TAIL TRACK.  THE ENGINEER STATED THAT HE SLOWLY CAME TO A STOP WITHOUT APPLYINGANY BRAKES.  THE ASSISTANT WALKED THE TRAIN AND FOUND 7 CARS DERAILED.  CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.

3077-d-09-03-05-IHB.Narrative: CREW DOUBLED UP TRAIN AND SHOVED EAST OUT OF 12 WEST ONTO SWITCHING LEAD TO CLEAR THORTON ROAD FOR AIR TEST. CREW RECEIVED AIR TEST AND STARTED PULLING WEST.  COULD NO LONGER PULLER TRAIN. FOUND TWO CARS DERAILED AT EAST END OF 12 WEST.  RUN THROUGH SWITCH, FOLLOWED BY REVERSE MOVEMENT THROUGH SAMESWITCH.
